oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: John Conlee Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with John Conlee (performer) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: John Conlee; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Biff Collie introduces himself as John Conlee and Conlee introduces himself as Collie -- (00:15) Conlee talks about "Where Are The Pieces Of My Heart" and it's writer Huge Prestwood -- (00:46) Conlee talks about changing labels and "River Of Time" which he believes to be a song about age -- (02:06) Collie and Conlee talks about how a song "clicks" and listening to fifty or more tracks and narrowing his selections -- (03:08) Collie and Conlee talk about the artists that inspire his music and making sure to listen to as much as he possibly can -- (04:20) Collie talks about a story he heard about Conway (Twitty) listening to the sounds of his publishing office which leads to Conlee to talk about how they discovered a track on the album -- (05:13) Conlee describes an unidentified song as having a "cajun feel" -- (05:38) Conlee talks about love for blues listing Ray Charles, Aretha Franklin, and B.B.King as examples -- (06:07) Conlee talks about a song (I Had The Time And Money Too) that's based around people with oil money -- (06:54) Conlee talks about "Fellow Travelers" as a message of unity in the human race -- (07:28) Conlee talks about a song he enjoys, about how he avoids labels, and instead searches for quality music -- (08:58) Conlee talks about "Knowin' You Were Leavin'" as a breakup tune -- (09:26) "Don't Get Me Started" is discussed as a new song that has had great response despite have not being released yet -- (10:15) Conlee describes "Almost Free" as a story about a person having almost left their spouse but turning around at the last second -- (10:48) Conlee thanks Collie for his time on -- (10:55) Conlee confirms his bus type -- (11:03) Conlee says "Alright, hope so"
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Conlee, John; Collie, Biff;
